full_text: #DyddGwylDewiHapus. To all our friends from Wales - Happy #StDavidsDay. A Triple Crown is a great way to celebrate - congratulations 🏉.  Looking forward to ever closer links between 🇮🇪 and 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿. @IrelandEmbGB @irelandinwales

Thanks to ⁦@GardaTraffic⁩ for professionalism & courage in face of thuggish & dangerous violence.  So many are making such sacrifices due to Covid to protect those who are vulnerable.  This was not acceptable protest & should be condemned by all.  https://t.co/Qg3RDjYlno

Air Corps pilot did a great job here to ensure a safe landing after plane suffers engine failure.  There will be a full investigation into what happened and how it happened. ⁦@defenceforces⁩  https://t.co/j4EIrflQQ8
Some good news on sustainability - still got a distance to travel, but moving in the right direction 🦋🐳🌳 https://t.co/pPPgJTB3v4

@piarais91 I assure you, I’ve condemned threats to all Public reps, and journalists too, regardless of party or political views. There should be no space for intimidation or violence as a political tool.

It’s the latest in a series of cowardly & despicable attempts at intimidation against public representatives from many different parties in Northern Ireland.  Such threats against elected public reps, journalists, their staff & families is utterly unacceptable.  Solidarity 🇮🇪🇬🇧 https://t.co/gLHlvGZgqD

Thoughts with ⁦@NicholaMallon⁩ tonight. No politician should face this kind of intimidation. Knowing Nichola, she will not be deterred. She’s a courageous politician and a great person!  https://t.co/TYEv3braAj
Ireland holds second place in world food security rankings https://t.co/RxxLZumHpQ

Sincere condolences to Dr Tony Holohan @CMOIreland and his family on the sad passing of his wife Emer. Our thoughts and prayers are with them at this sad time.
#welcomeback 🐳🇺🇸 https://t.co/CHwCX9bMTV

Completely agree. #Ireland will continue to raise serious concerns about #Tigray, #Ethiopia & #Eritrea at UN Security Council and EU.  Global focus needed to ensure Int. humanitarian access to ALL areas in Tigray & an end to violence. We must not turn a blind eye! https://t.co/rveZYYNxVP

@GerryO_Connor @SenatorMcDowell @MichealMartinTD @jerrybuttimer @sendboyle @EmerHigginsTD @PaulMcauliffe @seansherlocktd @HollyCairnsTD @ColmBurkeTD Gerry I can assure you that I and DFA are doing everything we can to ensure that Richard can come home to his family as soon as possible.

Positive call with @DominicRaab today. We focused on increasing U.K./IRE cooperation, bilaterally and on UNSC. Discussed #Climate, #Oceans, #Syria, #Ethiopia, #COVID19 & a little of #Brexit as ever. Looking forward to building stronger and more positive partnership. 🇮🇪🇬🇧🇺🇳 https://t.co/qBcKDWUQ5X

Very warm 1st conversation with @SecBlinken. Ireland/USA relationship stronger than ever. Good discussion on #Climate, JCPOA (Iran), Trans-Altantic relations, humanitarian assistance in #Syria, #Ethiopia, MEPP and bilateral issues. #Brexit & Northern Ireland also discussed. 🇮🇪🇺🇸 https://t.co/HtGKzQ5RKT

Deepest sympathies to family, friends & colleagues of Mark Mahon. We will honour and remember him. RIP. https://t.co/EGcFRCrQ8o

Thank you @FergalGaynor for being such a credible, strong candidate. #Ireland is fortunate to have people with your commitment to truth and justice on the international stage. Onwards and upwards... https://t.co/t4CGWoHMze

The COVID Business Aid Scheme agreed by Govt is aimed at businesses not eligible for CRSS but are closed or with turnover down 75%.  CBAS is a fund of €60m which will offer a payment of up to €8,000 for eligible businesses, in two installments of €4,000 for Q1+Q2. #COVID19
Got a very convincing presentation on this yesterday - exciting opportunity - 🐳  Wind energy can be as big as pharma in Cork Harbour, report claims  https://t.co/X66DU7jHBP

@hayward_katy The middle ground can be strong when it needs to be, and it needs to be now.  So let’s encourage a dialling down of heated rhetoric. The Protocol can work with cooperation and pragmatism, that’s our focus - the alternative, if we’re honest with people, is chaotic.

Great to hear positive comment on NI Protocol. There are significant advantages for NI flowing from barrier free access to EU & GB. Yes there are issues to address & we will work with all sides on that. But let’s be straight with people & give as much certainty as we can. #Brexit https://t.co/X51HCIsBpk
@defenceforces doing a great job. #COVID19 #StaySafe https://t.co/XQbM3TdexU
Good scheme from @EamonRyan - makes sense to support Taxi and Hackney drivers to go electric. https://t.co/53yuHNIkv4

@johnmooreni John, I recognise implementation problems with Protocol & we’re working to address this with UKGov & EU. But I have a responsibility to be honest about about what solutions are possible. The Protocol is UK/EU agreed to manage #Brexit disruption, there’s no credible alternative.
Balanced piece of journalism, making a lot of sense:  - EU and UK need to work together to make the Northern Ireland protocol work.  https://t.co/yqjBARX7EJ
Love this..... always find a reason to smile. Thanks @GardaTraffic @gardainfo for this and for all the work you continue to do through #COVID19 https://t.co/vob25Ce88Z

The safety of those working in NI Ports must always be a priority. I condemn any intimidation or threats and support @PSNI and political leaders in efforts to reduce tension. #Brexit ⁦@rtenews⁩  https://t.co/AIkM8KjNiR
https://t.co/ZADKk3F1Rm

Spoke with @MarosSefcovic @michaelgove @BrandonLewis today. We agreed to focus on protecting Ire/NI Protocol & to ensure that implementation works for everyone. Protocol is there to protect relationships, facilitate trade, avoid borders. We’ll cont. to work on outstanding issues.

EU Com statement tonight confirming NI Protocol Art 16, safeguard clause, will not be triggered.  Welcome news, but lessons should be learned; the Protocol is not something to be tampered with lightly, it’s an essential, hard won compromise, protecting peace & trade for many. https://t.co/QLKpfhR9Yt
@sayitasitis20 @JP_Biz We are working on getting it resolved, I assure you.
We are working with the EU Commission to try to resolve this issue and protect the integrity and operation of the NI Protocol. https://t.co/noTL49v4Go

Tommie Gorman is more than a v good journalist, he’s a person who cares deeply about N Ireland, its people & its future. I’ve learned so much from #TommieGorman about the complexity & sensitivities of politics in NI. We’ll miss is coverage. Happy retirement! ⁦⁦@rtenews⁩ https://t.co/ZO9ywmrMh0
I want to wish @vincekearney well as new @rtenews Northern Editor - We will all miss the great Tommie Gorman but I look forward to working with Vincent. https://t.co/NfeD4OQKWA

#Ireland congratulates @KamalaHarris on her historic achievement as she is inaugurated as the first woman, and first woman of colour, to hold the office of US Vice President. We look forward to working with her and would be delighted to welcome her and @DouglasEmhoff to Ireland. https://t.co/cOcKrAdwlL

#Ireland takes great pride in inauguration of @JoeBiden as US⁦⁦⁦President. We hope to welcome him to his ancestral home early in his Presidency. He has always been a friend to Ireland & we look forward to working with him on strengthening Irish/US relations & much more. https://t.co/YET6XysuTX
